doc.title: Burnt Oranges
doc.plot: Experimental documentary about the long-term effects of Argentina's 1970's state terrorism. The film vividly reveals current life in Buenos Aires through the eyes of a long-gone native, while it also records and uncovers compelling testimonies of resistance, transformation, and hope. The film establishes links between the struggles of the Argentine people with today's world's necessity to defend human rights, and preserve human dignity and democratic values. Winner of the Cine Golden Eagle Award.
